content.value_statement: Building Next.js applications requires understanding App Router, Server Components, and performance patterns. This skill provides expert architecture guidance for designing, migrating, and optimizing Next.js applications with modern patterns.
actual_capabilities: Design Next.js application structure using App Router patterns
Migrate applications from Pages Router to App Router
Implement Server Components and define client boundaries
Optimize Next.js performance with static generation and ISR
Apply Next.js best practices for full-stack applications
Create routing architecture with route groups and layouts
limitations: Does not execute code or modify project files directly
Does not install dependencies or configure build tools
Does not provide live debugging or runtime analysis
Cannot access local project files without explicit request

best_practices: Use Server Components as the default and add use client only when needed
Apply static generation for content that changes infrequently
Use Suspense boundaries to stream slow data without blocking the page
anti_patterns: Converting every component to Client Components unnecessarily
Fetching data in Client Components when Server Components can handle it
Skipping Suspense boundaries for slow database queries

faq.question: Which Next.js versions support App Router?
faq.answer: App Router requires Next.js 13 or later. Version 14+ recommended for production use.

faq.question: What is the difference between Server and Client Components?
faq.answer: Server Components render on the server and reduce bundle size. Client Components run in the browser.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with existing Next.js projects?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill provides guidance for both new projects and migrations from Pages Router.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my project files?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides architecture recommendations. You apply changes manually to your codebase.

faq.question: What rendering strategies does this skill cover?
faq.answer: Static generation, ISR, SSR, and streaming with Suspense for progressive loading.

faq.question: How does this compare to standard Next.js documentation?
faq.answer: This skill provides curated architectural patterns and practical migration guidance beyond basic documentation.
